column1: [CXOne Phase 1] - Postman Collection & Mapping Updates for Contact Update API for SMS Preferences
column34:
As an Team MobiRangers, we want a Postman Collection to be available for the Contact Update API with a customer’s SMS Text Preferences, so that we may prepare and test for inbound updates into mCAS for a customer’s texting preference response.

Details:

* Contact Update API has the customer’s SMS Text Preferences included
* Postman Collection for Contact Update API is available for updating customer’s SMS Text Preferences in mCAS
column90:
*AC01 - Ability To Consume Yes Response From Customer For Their Opt-in To SMS Texting Preference (Opt-In Confirmation)*
GIVEN there is a Person contact on an mCAS claim with SMS Texting Preference Fields Available
WHEN a Customer responds Yes for Opt-In To SMS Texting
AND CCM (API HUB team) will call the Claim API (patchclaimContact) 
THEN the Opt-in To SMS Texting for the Home Phone Number value is updated to Yes
AND/OR the Opt-in To SMS Texting for the Mobilt Phone Number is updated to Yes

*AC02 - Ability To Consume No Response From Customer For Their Opt-in To SMS Texting Preference (Opt-Out Confirmation)*
GIVEN there is a Person contact on an mCAS claim with SMS Texting Preference Fields Available
WHEN a Customer responds No for Opt-In To SMS Texting
AND CCM (API HUB team) will call the Claim API (patchclaimContact) 
THEN the Opt-in To SMS Texting for the Home Phone Number value is updated to No
AND/OR the Opt-in To SMS Texting for the Mobilt Phone Number is updated to No

Scenarios:

# Existing Pending → Yes Update
# Existing Pending → No Update
# Existing Yes → No Update
# Existing No → Yes Update

Note:  This API will not check about the existing value set on Opt-in To SMS Texting field to set the value to “Yes” (instead the Pending value from CC is sent and return/set the value “Yes” which is passed on the Payload from CCM)

column1: [1099] mCAS - Vendor not found error in the Vendor1099Reporting message queue
column34:
Vendor1099Reporting message queue has error messages for different vendors where it says vendor with linkID not found.

Sample error: 02-Vendor with linkID: abh:ShEapJl2fl7Js6B1Wppw0 not found

!image-20250410-144615.png|width=1246,height=265,alt="image-20250410-144615.png"!



Root Cause: Contact is deleted in CM



Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a new vendor in CC which will go for 1099 approval in CM
# User cannot issue a payment to the new vendor until it’s approved in CM by 1099 team
# 1099 team rejected the contact and deleted it in the CM
# Once contact is deleted in CM, adjuster will see the contact is unlinked in CC
# Adjuster will issue a payment in CC on a deleted CM vendor contact 
# Payment is successful in CC and CM will throw error back to CC in 1099Reporting queue that vendor not found.



Proposed Fix:

# Modify the "The check cannot be created for a contact that is not linked to the Address Book" validation to identify contacts that are rejected as part of the “Pending Changes → Create” ContactManager intake process, so that no check can be issued to a vendor that is not in ContactManager.

UI Reference / Screenshot for ContactManager Pending Changes → Create

column1: [CXone Phase 1] Capture Changes To Text Preferences within mCAS via New Note Creation [UI]
column34: As an mCAS user, I want changes to a cusomter’s text preferences to be tracked on the claim, so there is an audit trail available of the customer’s choices to opt-in and opt-out of test messaging for their respective phone numbers on the claim.
column90:
*AC01 - New Note Topics (SMS Preference and SMS Conversation) Added - Only Available For System Generated Notes*
GIVEN I am creating a mCAS Claim
AND a trigger event occurs for a system generated Note (i.e. for the Opt in SMS Texting option update - Yes/No/Pending and/or i.e. Adjuster communicates with the customer by text message through via CCM)
WHEN the system creates a new Note
THEN the New Note Topics value can be set to “SMS Preference” and “SMS Conversation” 

*** Note (5/1): SMS Conversation related notes details (like Secuity, Subject, etc.,) will be part of SRNGR-715. This is just to create the Topic only.

*AC02 - New Note Topics NOT Available For Manual User Selection*
GIVEN I am +*creating a new Note*+ in mCAS
WHEN I select the the Topic field drop down
THEN the topic values of “SMS Preference” and “SMS Conversation” are NOT available to select

!image-20250408-210046.png|width=1918,height=867,alt="image-20250408-210046.png"!

*AC03 - Note Screen Filtering - SMS Topics Available For Manual User Selection*
GIVEN I am on the Notes screen of an mCAS claim
WHEN I select the the Topic field drop down
THEN the topic values of “SMS Preference” and “SMS Conversation” are available to select 

!image-20250408-205942.png|width=1917,height=867,alt="image-20250408-205942.png"!

*AC04 - Notes Screen - CANNOT Edit or Delete Existing SMS Related Note*
GIVEN I am on the Notes screen of an mCAS claim
WHEN the Note’s Topic is “SMS Preference” or “SMS Conversation”
THEN I am NOT able to edit the Note
AND I am NOT able to Delete the Note

!image-20250410-165705.png|width=1913,height=867,alt="image-20250410-165705.png"!

*AC05 - SMS Preference Change Captured With New Note*
GIVEN a new claim is created
OR I am editing an existing mCAS claim
AND the “EnableCustomerTexting” toggle is On
WHEN a new Person contact is created that adds a value to the Home or Mobile Phone Number’s Opt-in To SMS Texting field
OR an existing Person contact has edits made to the value of the Home or Mobile Phone Number’s Opt-in To SMS Texting field
THEN a note is created with the below details: 

* Topic = SMS Preference
* Security Type – Public
* Subject – SMS Communications Mobilitas
* Related To = Contact in which the SMS update was made.
* Confidential = No
* Text – Opt-in for SMS Texting for [insert Home or Mobile] Phone Number ###-###-#### has been updated to [new status]”





----

Notes: 

* The change will be captured as a +*note*+ and NOT as a history line on the History screen.

column1: [CXOne Phase 1] - Lyft FNOL API Specific Behaviors - Default Opt-In Pending For New Persons Created
column34: As an mCAS user, I want certain Lyft FNOL parties invovled to default and have specific behaviors, so that specific business processes are followed for text messaging with Lyft parties.
column90:
*Note (4/30): The below listed acceptance criteria pertain to Lyft FNOL API not for manual process*

*AC01 - Lyft FNOL Submission - Person Party Involved - Default Opt-in to SMS Texting to Pending For* +*Home*+ *Phone Number*
GIVEN a Lyft FNOL API is submitted
WHEN a new Person contact type is created based upon the Lyft FNOL Claim Submission for a Driver, Passenger or Pedestrian
AND the +*Home*+ Phone Number is provided
THEN the contact profile created in mCAS will default the Opt-in To SMS Texting field for the Home Phone Number as 'Pending'
AND the system should create a new Note “SMS Preference” Topic with the details as below

* Topic = SMS Preference

* Security Type – Public
* Subject – SMS Communications Mobilitas
* Related To = Contact in which the SMS update was made.
* Confidential = No
* Text – Opt-in for SMS Texting for [insert Home or Mobile] Phone Number ###-###-#### has been updated to [new status]”

*AC02 - Lyft FNOL Submission - Person Party Involved - Default Opt-in to SMS Texting to Pending For* +*Mobile*+ *Phone Number*
GIVEN a Lyft FNOL API is submitted
WHEN a new Person contact type is created based upon the Lyft FNOL Claim Submission for a Driver, Passenger or Pedestrian
AND the +*Mobile*+ Phone Number is provided
THEN the contact profile created in mCAS will default the Opt-in To SMS Texting field for the Mobile Phone Number as 'Pending'
AND the system should create a new Note “SMS Preference” Topic with the details as below

* Topic = SMS Preference

* Security Type – Public
* Subject – SMS Communications Mobilitas
* Related To = Contact in which the SMS update was made.
* Confidential = No
* Text – Opt-in for SMS Texting for [insert Home or Mobile] Phone Number ###-###-#### has been updated to [new status]”

→ If both the Home Phone Number & Mobile Phone Number are unique and submitted together then both will be consumed and the opt-in set to Pending.

→ The solution approach will make changes at the AWS layer and not in mCAS.

→ Driver, Passenger and Pedestrian are the expected role types within mCAS that would be created following a new LFYT FNOL API submitted claim to have this behavior.

column1: [CXOne Phase 1] - Phone Numbers Conditions (Additional Screens & Flows)
column34:
As an mCAS user, I want to have additional enhancements related to Phone number fields for a Person contact type to have specific conditions & behaviors for texting preferences during FNOL and Post FNOL, so that the system aligns with business expectations for text communications with eligible customers.

Details:

# Restrict the user to enter the duplicate phone numbers on Mobile/Home Phone number fields during FNOL wherever the new person contact can be created (Ex: Basic Info, Loss Details, Parties Involved, etc.,) and triggers this validation message ““Home and Mobile Phone Numbers cannot be the same. Please enter unique phone numbers or only input as either a Home or Mobile Phone Number.”

!image-20250430-030439.png|width=50%,alt="image-20250430-030439.png"!

# Restrict the user to update the contact with the duplicate phone numbers on Mobile/Home Phone number fields during FNOL and Post FNOL for an existing/established contact (whichever is created/updated) and triggers this validation message ““Home and Mobile Phone Numbers cannot be the same. Please enter unique phone numbers or only input as either a Home or Mobile Phone Number.”
# System to remove (not to display) the new field “Opt-in to SMS Texting” when the Home Phone Number and/or Mobile Phone Number is removed for any person contact regardless of the value opted. This needs to be consistent across both FNOL and Post FNOL related screens wherever its applicable.
                                           

!image-20250429-232152.png|width=578,height=313,alt="image-20250429-232152.png"!
column90:
*AC01 - FNOL - Home and Mobile Phone Numbers CANNOT Be the Same for a new contact*

GIVEN I am creating a new mCAS claim
WHEN I create a new Person contact during FNOL
AND I update the same number on both Mobile Phone Number and Home Phone Number fields
THEN System should not allow to update that contact
AND display this error / validation message: “Home and Mobile Phone Numbers cannot be the same. Please enter unique phone numbers or only input as either a Home or Mobile Phone Number.”

 {color:#4c9aff}*** Note: This acceptance criteria covers wherever the Person contact can be created in UI during FNOL ex; Basic Info, Loss Details, Parties Involved, etc.,{color}

      -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*AC02(a) - FNOL - Home and Mobile Phone Numbers CANNOT Be the Same for an established contact* 

GIVEN I am creating a new mCAS claim
WHEN I create a new Person contact with the Phone Numbers (Mobile/Home) and all the required details 
AND I edit the respective existing contact (which was created in the above step)
AND I update the same number on both Mobile Phone Number and Home Phone Number fields
THEN System should not allow to update that contact
AND display this error / validation message: “Home and Mobile Phone Numbers cannot be the same. Please enter unique phone numbers or only input as either a Home or Mobile Phone Number.”

{color:#4c9aff}*** This acceptance criteria covers wherever the Person contact can be created in UI during FNOL ex; Basic Info, Loss Details, Parties Involved, etc.,{color}

*AC02(b) - POST FNOL - Home and Mobile Phone Numbers CANNOT Be the Same for an established contact*
GIVEN I am accessing an existing mCAS claim
WHEN I create a new Person contact with the Phone Numbers (Mobile/Home) and all the required details
OR I edit an existing contact
AND I update the same number on both Mobile Phone Number and Home Phone Number fields on the existing contact
THEN System should not allow to update that contact
AND display this error / validation message: “Home and Mobile Phone Numbers cannot be the same. Please enter unique phone numbers or only input as either a Home or Mobile Phone Number.

{color:#4c9aff}*** This acceptance criteria covers wherever the Person contact can be created/updated in UI during POST FNOL ex; Loss Details, Exposures, Parties Involved, Policy, Injury, Services, Activity, Subrogation, Litigation, etc.,{color}

                 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*AC03(a) FNOL - Established Phone Number Is Removed When SMS Field Was Already Set To A Value → System Removes SMS Field Value*
GIVEN I am creating a new mCAS claim
AND I create a new Person contact with the Phone Numbers (Mobile/Home) and all the required details
AND the Opt-in To SMS Texting is visible with a value set on this field already
WHEN I edit the respective existing contact (which was created in the above step)
AND the Home and/or Mobile Phone Number is removed
THEN the corresponding Opt-in To SMS Texting field value (which was captured already) should be removed by the system

{color:#4c9aff}*** This acceptance criteria covers wherever the Person contact can be created in UI during FNOL ex; Basic Info, Loss Details, Parties Involved, etc.,{color}

*AC03(b) POST FNOL - Established Phone Number Is Removed When SMS Field Was Already Set To A Value → System Removes SMS Field Value*
GIVEN I am accessing an new mCAS claim
AND I create a new Person contact with the Phone Numbers (Mobile/Home) and all the required details
OR I edit an existing contact
AND the Opt-in To SMS Texting is visible with a value set on this field already
WHEN I edit the respective existing contact
AND the Home and/or Mobile Phone Number is removed
THEN the corresponding Opt-in To SMS Texting field value should be removed by the system

{color:#4c9aff}*** This acceptance criteria covers wherever the Person contact can be created/updated in UI during POST FNOL ex; Loss Details, Exposures, Parties Involved, Policy, Injury, Services, Activity, Subrogation, Litigation, etc.,{color}

22/May/25 10:23 AM;557058:db8fae87-6023-47bc-ad71-e769fd9be468;Root cause details (note some of this is pending confirmation with GW – will update if it deviates from what’s below): 
There is some validation that occurs against the policy graph when in Prod mode to ensure the validity of the policy image. This validation uses the API schemas to check the structure of the policy. Now, back when we were working on Project Mercury, scheduled items were not part of the APD product generation, meaning the API schemas did not include as part of the base offering any schema definition for scheduled items. In order to support that, we built our own implementation of the scheduled item entity. That schema was built around the CA7 product definition and included a property called options. That property is not available on the CAP product, which should have thrown an error during earlier updates, but it appears that Scheduled Items were not included in previous versions. 

In Mammoth, there appears to have been a fix done by GW which then included validation of scheduled items, and because our extensions called out a property called options that wasn’t present on CAP, existing CAP policies began to fail validation. However, by this point, we’re no longer using the API that required the introduction of that extension schema and, by now, OOTB now includes a mapping for scheduled item. To resolve this issue, the old extension was removed, leaving only validation against the OOTB schema, which is working fine.

Impact of this rollback is that CA7 quoting integrations with scheduled prop will no longer work. This has been communicated, but it is not a concern at this point given the status of the CA7 product and lack of any external integrations utilizing the scheduled item.

column1: [DEV] Harsh Brake Rating: Update Adj Factor System Table and CW Rate Book
column34:
As a product manager, I want the adjustment factor unique per coverage to ensure premium calculation matches 1:1 between the system and external calculations. 

*Acceptance Criteria*

* Ability to have an adjustment factor per coverage - BI, Medpay, PIP, PD, UM, and APD
** System table updates effective 10/1/25.
** CW Rate book effective 10/1/25.
* Ability to calculate adjusted premium per coverage using the coverage specific adjustment factor.
** See example attached.
* Requires rate routine calculation changes to split Liability BI and Liability PD.
** Liability BI Term Amount = Liability BI Factor for given Period/Rate Bucket * Adjustment Factor * Harsh Brake Mileage
** Liability PD Term Amount = Liability PD Factor for given Period/Rate Bucket * Adjustment Factor * Harsh Brake Mileage
** Liability [BI + PD] Term Amount = Liability BI Term Amount + Liability PD Term Amount
** No changes needed for UM/UIM.

!image-20250411-201022.png|width=50%,alt="image-20250411-201022.png"!

* Regression to validate no impact to current behavior of Adj Factor.
column90:

GIVEN Adjustment Factors need to be programmed for Harsh Brake Rating

WHEN the factors are loaded into the system table

THEN the adjustment factor corresponding to each coverage should populate



AC #2

GIVEN a policy change and/or premium audit is processed, effective on/after the effective date of the Adj Factor

WHEN the system quotes

THEN the adjustment factor for that coverage should be used in premium calculation



AC #3

GIVEN a policy has Liability BI and PD

WHEN the system calculates premium

THEN each coverage should be calculated separately, with corresponding Adj Factor, and summed together for term amount

column1: Commercial Auto Plus: Ability to Report Estimated Earned Premium for Multi- State Policies
column34:
As a Finance Manager, I need estimated earned premiums reported monthly for multi- state policies by state and coverage.

Note: We are already reporting estimated earned premium for single state policies, such as Lyft Rideshare.



+*Requirements:*+

* Ability to report Estimated Earned Premium by state and coverage, for a single policy, if multiple states exist.
** Coverages include, Liability, APD, and/or No- fault [MedPay, PIP] coverages.
*** Coverage Names for MedPay/PIP - Medical Payments and Personal Injury Protection.
** A single policy can have up to 51 jurisdictions and up to 3 unique coverages (above) per location.
** Solution: Currently there is a unique key generated per policy per coverage to identify a record from DynamoDB while creating a GL line item (e.g. {{VABA140001299330_04/30/2024 00:01:00_1}}). This logic to generate the Unique key needs to be changed to ensure it can still uniquely identify same coverage for a policy at multiple states.
* Ability to deliver the Monthly Estimated Earned Premium (EEP) file to General Ledger with multi- state policies.
** Ensure each jurisdiction is sequenced together for a single policy.
* Ensure no impacts to current ingestion process or schedules [Regression]
* Ensure that we follow same flow for existing EEP process [Regression]
* Note: Testing with the GL team is required.
